text:
I have a machine that was under heavy memory load. Because of this, when running
an ant-build, the fork that is done as part of the command 

<property environment="env"/> 

failed with an out of  memory exception. 

The problem is that the properties for environment variables were simnply not
set after this, but the build continued without stopping. 

I think the build should rather stop to let the user see this condition,
otherwise builds fail mysteriously in a much later stage when some env-variables
are not set correctly.
creator: dominik.stadler@gmx.at

text: the current behaviour is consistent with <property file="..."/> not doing anything if the file is not there.
